```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)

data = read.csv("DataTable.csv")

library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(knitr)

```

# Kernel Safety Tests

Firstly, we run random tests to ensure that the kernels are safe and that they do work.

```{r, kernel_safety}
kernel_gen = data %>%
  filter(eval_name=="KernelGen")%>%
  select(map_name, SSS_avg_interventions, SSS_avg_times, SSS_std_dev, SSS_success_rate)
  
kable(kernel_gen)
```

# Learning Investigation

```{r}
reward = data %>%
  filter(eval_name=="RewardTest") %>%
  select(agent_name, r1, r2, rk, constant_reward, SSS_avg_times, SSS_success_rate, Wo_avg_times, Wo_success_rate)%>%
     arrange(agent_name)


kable(reward)
```

   arrange(desc(agent_name))
